explanation: Scroll, Tablet (clay), Parchment, and Papyrus are all historical materials or forms used for writing and preserving information in ancient times. A Microscope is an optical instrument used for viewing very small objects.

category: Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
explanation: The Great Pyramid of Giza, Lighthouse of Alexandria, Hanging Gardens of Babylon, and Colossus of Rhodes are all traditionally listed among the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Stonehenge, while an ancient and historically significant monument, is not part of this specific list.
Giggle, Chuckle, Snicker, and Cackle are all distinct vocalizations of laughter, involving sound. A smile is a facial expression of pleasure or amusement, but it does not involve a vocal sound.
